Your husband need to go back to the doctor for a referral to a urologist.The sensation of burning whilst urinating can be from a bladder infection and from very acidic urine.Seeing blood in the urine in men can be from a urinary tract infection or stones and also from a prostate problem.Another reason for increase in frequency can be from the prostate gland being enlarged and also from diabetes.Get your husband to make an appointment with his doctor for a referral to a urologist, and blood tests taken to check his blood for diabetes, liver and kidney function and prostate problems.He leaking from the anus may be from diverticular disease.  This needs looking into as well.Best wishes.

question: My husband is 30 years old and is healthy aside from having high blood pressure. For the past 4 years my husband has had problems while urinating. At first he had burning while urinating. Throughout the years, the burning persists and has increase in frequency and decreased in flow/stream. At times he has spotted blood. Recently he has noticed he has leaked from his anus.The doctors have tried all types of exams and medications and nothing has worked. Any advice would help.Thanks!
